project.teaser: "As of today, 80% of the data processing and analysis occurs in cloud data centers, and only 20% of processing occurs at the edge. This incipient exploitation of edge resources increases time to value and prevents business processes, decisions, and intelligence to be taken...
project.objective:
"As of today, 80% of the data processing and analysis occurs in cloud data centers, and only 20% of processing occurs at the edge. This incipient exploitation of edge resources increases time to value and prevents business processes, decisions, and intelligence to be taken outside of the data center, which prevents Europe to unlock an entire set of new opportunities to serve different industries and use cases in Europe in the next years. To help to materialize the European bid on a true continuum in the next few years, CloudSkin pursues to build a cognitive cloud continuum platform with three main innovations:
1. The CloudSkin platform will leverage AI/ML to optimize workloads, resources, energy, and network traffic for a rapid adaptation to changes in application behavior and data variability, re-configuraing the ""sweet spot"" between the cloud and the edge in the face of the rapid varying conditions; 2. The CloudSkin platform will also help users to achieve stack identicality across the Cloud-edge continuum, whereby the same (legacy) software stacks (e.g., MPI programs) running in data centers can seamlessly run at remote edges. The development of a new lightweight, portable virtualizaion abstraction will be paired with the development of new confidential abstractions to protect data while it is in use; and 3. CloudSkin will also contribute to prepare the needed infrastructure to integrate the new virtualized execution abstractions into the virtual resource continuum, particularly, for those Cloud-edge applications composed of small tasks with fast data access and sharing requirements. The infrastructure will expose the relevant control knobs to enable dynamic reconfiguration of resources as assisted by the AI/ML-based orchestration plane in the CloudSkin platform.
Altogether, the above innovations are the strategic elements of what we envision as the new cognitive continuum for the cloud and edge""."
project.title: Adaptive virtualization for AI-enabled Cloud-edge Continuum
project.keywords: Cloud, edge computing, AI, ML optimization, virtualization, confidential computing, storage

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - CloudSkin (Adaptive virtualization for AI-enabled Cloud-edge Continuum)
result.teaser: As of today, 80% of the data processing and analysis occurs in Cloud data centres, while only 20% of processing occurs at the edge. With the spirit of curtailing the inter-dependency of the non-EU Cloud providers, the general objective of the project is to design a cognitive...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

webItem.alternativeText: Layered Architecture for the CloudSkin platform

result.title: SinClave

details.authors: Franz Gregor; Robert Krahn; Do Le Quoc; Christof Fetzer

result.title: Active Ephemeral Data Store Release Candidate and Specification
result.description: Interim report with details on integration of active compute elements. Early access prototype and initial results from experiments with different workloads.

result.title: A Last-Level Defense for Application Integrity and Confidentiality

details.authors: Fernandez, Gabriel P.; Brito, Andrey; Hartono, Ardhi Putra Pratama; Sardar, Muhammad Usama; Fetzer, Christof
details.journalTitle: IEEE/ACM 16th International Conference on Utility and Cloud Computing (UCC 2023)

result.title: Design and early prototype of CLOUDSKIN Learning Plane
result.description: Design of the architecture and technologies to produce the CLOUDSKIN Learning Plane, and first prototype with demonstration case.

result.title: Data Management Plan, 1st version
result.description: First version of the Data Management Plan. Experiments, workloads, benchmarks, and results will be delivered as open data to the community. This deliverable will evolve during the lifetime of the project in order to reflect the current status of data management.

result.title: Triad: Trusted Timestamps in Untrusted Environments

details.authors: G. Pereira Fernandez, A. Brito, and C. Fetzer

result.title: Public Project Website
result.description: A website will be developed in order to provide a continuous update about the project progress and the resultsobtained during it. All public deliverables and publications (Open Access) will be uploaded on the website.

result.title: On Data Processing through the Lenses of S3 Object Lambda
Experiments, Initial Specifications and Testbed specs
result.description: Description of use case scenarios, experiments and benchmarking framework.Initial specifications of the architecture.First version of Cloud-edge testbed with enumeration of required services in different Clouds. The testbed should be available by month M12 to execute first experiments.This deliverable will evolve during the lifetime of the project in order to present the status of the project's reflections on data management.

result.title: Initial prototype for Cloud-edge cells
result.description: Early software release of Cloud-edge cells virtualisation technology for different environments (C/C++, Python) as well as partial TEE support to ensure confidentiality and integrity of the involved components.

result.title: Communication Report
result.description: Description of the dissemination activities with lessons learned andprogress reporting. Further, it will describe community involvement activities.

result.title: Data Management Plan, 2nd version
result.description: This deliverable presents the second version of the project Data Management Plan (DMP). It is submitted on Month 18 as a Mid–Term review of the CLOUDSKIN Data Management Plan.

result.title: Ephemeral Data Store Release Candidate and Specifications
result.description: Interim report with details on data store design including performance tier, disaggregated storage tier and integration with persistent data store for checkpointing/recovery. Early access prototypes and initial results from benchmarking framework and experiments.

result.title: Scaling a Variant Calling Genomics Pipeline with FaaS

details.authors: Aitor Arjona; Arnau Gabriel-Atienza; Sara Lanuza-Orna; Xavier Roca-Canals; Ayman Bourramouss; Tyler K. Chafin; Lucio Marcello; Paolo Ribeca; Pedro García-López
details.journalTitle: Proceedings of the 9th International Workshop on Serverless Computing

result.title: Early release of Ephemeral Data Store
result.description: Early software release of the data store, focusing on definition of API's and application integrationof the performance tier.

result.title: Learning methods for Infrastructure and Workload management
result.description: Specification and first testing models on the different knowledge generation and decision making mechanisms. The produced models and their reproducible validation will be published through open-source distribution channels.

result.title: CLOUDSKIN Architecture Specs and Early Prototypes
result.description: Specification of the Architecture and APIs. Documentation, early tutorials, and automated tests for the early prototypes of the different software components. First description and evaluation of the results obtained from use cases' validation using different experiments and workloads.

result.title: Cloud-edge cells Release Candidate and Specifications
result.description: Interim report with details on Cloud-edge cells design and summaries for outcomes of each task. Description of specifications and APIs of backend extensible infrastructure for different clouds and heterogeneous resources. Early access prototypes and initial results for different use cases as well as confidential orchestrator support. It will include early experiment results with use case applications in Python, C++, and JavaScript.

result.title: Communication Plan
result.description: Definition of the required process and strategy for dissemination activities.Description of the planned dissemination activities and expected progress reporting. Description of initial planned community involvement activities.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
